item.title: Coffee and Conversation - R-Ladies St. Louis
item.description:
Chapter: R-Ladies St. Louis

When: Saturday, February 28, 2026 at 4:30 PM UTC

Where: Webster Groves Public Library

Attendees: 13 going

Join us for a morning of conversation and networking with fellow women in data. If you’re interested in data careers, looking to hire from underrepresented groups in data, or wanting to brainstorm about a project you’ve been working on, we’d love to see you. This is an in-person event and refreshments will be provided, so we appreciate your RSVP.

item.title: [IN-PERSON] #tidytuesday Work Group (on a Monday) - R-Ladies RTP
item.description:
Chapter: R-Ladies RTP

When: Monday, February 2, 2026 at 11:00 PM UTC

Attendees: 2 going

Join fellow R-Ladies in exploring a #tidytuesday data set! For those craving human connection and some practice flexing your data science skills, this is the event for you! We will hold our event via Zoom, where you can meet other R-ladies, improve your R skills, and build your data science portfolio. This event is for people at all levels of R (beginner through advanced). At this event, we'll revisit one of the Tidy Tuesday datasets on The Simpsons (originally from Kaggle). You can read more about it here: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/main/data/2025/2025-02-04/readme.md. Agenda (all times in ET): 6:00 - 6:15 pm Meet & Greet 6:15 - 7:15 pm #tidytuesday 7:15 - 7:30 pm Discussion What is #tidytuesday? #TidyTuesday is a weekly social data project created by the R4DS online learning community that is focused on using tidyverse packages. A new data set and accompanying article featuring an interesting plot is released on Github every Monday. The goal is to generate a copy of the original plot or create your own original approach! For more information on #tidytuesday, check out [this blog post](https://bit.ly/2HqEsdt) and [the main repository page](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday). Who is this for? New and experienced R users alike! Let's learn together! All are welcome, including R-Ladies RTP members and R-Ladies from around the world. What should I bring? You'll need a computer with videoconferencing capabilities and R. Serve yourself a beverage and a snack to fuel your evening! Where will it take place? **Please join us in-person in Duke University, Old Chemistry Building Room 201.** Old Chem is next to Bostock Library. The closest nearby public parking deck is the Bryan Center Parking Garage on Science Drive. All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend *as guests* and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

View event details
item.author: noreply@rladies.org (R-Ladies RTP)

item.title: Programando en R con GitHub Copilot - R-Ladies Santa Rosa
item.description:
Chapter: R-Ladies Santa Rosa

When: Saturday, January 31, 2026 at 1:00 PM UTC

Where: Online event

Attendees: 7 going

R-Ladies Santa Rosa invita a una charla para descubrir cómo **GitHub Copilot puede integrarse en el trabajo diario con R.** **Yanina Bellini Saibene mostrará aplicaciones prácticas tanto en la interfaz de GitHub como en RStudio,** explorando cómo este asistente ayuda a escribir código y a probar ideas. No se requiere experiencia previa con Copilot, solo curiosidad por nuevas formas de programar y compartir en comunidad. ¡Te esperamos!

View event details
item.author: noreply@rladies.org (R-Ladies Santa Rosa)

item.title: Git & GitHub: Practical Version Control for Data Work - R-Ladies Rome
item.description:
Chapter: R-Ladies Rome

When: Thursday, January 29, 2026 at 6:00 PM UTC

Where: Online event

Attendees: 100 going

Version control is no longer optional for data analysis, research, or collaborative projects. In this session, we introduce **Git and GitHub** with a practical, workflow-driven approach. We will cover: * What Git is and why it matters for reproducibility and collaboration * Core concepts: repositories, commits, branches, and history * Using GitHub to share work, track changes, and collaborate safely * Common workflows for data scientists and analysts The session is designed for beginners and self-taught users who want a clear mental model and practical habits they can immediately apply. No prior experience with Git is required. Bring curiosity and your laptop.

View event details
item.author: noreply@rladies.org (R-Ladies Rome)

item.title: Analyse Factorielle Multiple: analyses de groupes de variables (quanti et quali) - R-Ladies Limoges
item.description:
Chapter: R-Ladies Limoges

When: Wednesday, January 28, 2026 at 11:30 AM UTC

Where: Faculté des Lettres & des Sciences Humaines

Attendees: 2 going

Nous présentons l’analyse factorielle multiple ou (AFM, Escofier & Pagès 1994) avec le package R [FactoMineR](http://factominer.free.fr/factomethods/analyse-factorielle-multiple.html) (Josse & Husson 2008). Cette approche a pour but de cibler de grandes tendances variationelles au sein d’un jeu de données comprenant plusieurs groupes de variables (ex : **groupe 1** « personnalité », **variable 1** : « timidité », **var. 2** : « résistance au stress », **var. 3** : « sociabilité » …). Les variables peuvent être qualitatives, quantitatives ou les deux. Le nombre de variables par groupe peut varier et l’importance de chaque groupe est pondérée de façon à ce qu’ils aient le même poids. Cette approche est utilisée dans les études de comportement alimentaire (Ares et al. 2010), en écologie (Poulard et Léauté 2008), sensorimétrie (Stanimirova et al. 2011), sociolinguistique (Amand 2019) ou pour analyser les résultats de questionnaires d’enquête de satisfaction (Bécue-Bertaut et al. 2008). L’AFM permet, en outre, de hiérarchiser soit les variables, soit les groupes de variables en fonction de leur influence sur la variation générale. L’AFM met également en valeur les types de corrélation présents entre les variables. Combinée à une classification hiérarchique (Husson 2010), il est possible de construire des groupes d’individus basés sur les schémas variationnels dominants dégagés par l’AFM. Des graphiques accompagnent chaque tableau de diagnostique de l’AFM (grandes tendances, co-occurrence, groupes d’individus et individus médians ou atypiques), ce qui facilite l’interprétation.

View event details
item.author: noreply@rladies.org (R-Ladies Limoges)
